update.description:
* A bunch of fixes to please static analysis.

    clang static analysis points out a number of problems in the
    tests.  A few of these are real; in the unlikely event that
    they ever failed, the test would crash.  The rest are false
    positives in that the test as currently written would prevent
    the crash, but clang throws a warning anyway.  However, we
    can please clang and keep the original intent by switching
    most of these to ASSERT_NE(nullptr, ptr_to_test), which will
    have better error messages anyway.  With this change, sdformat
    is clang static analysis clean.

* Fix memory leaks pointed out by asan.

    Both cases were leaking memory at different points, which building
    with -fsanitize=address pointed out.
update.title: Static analysis fixes

content.raw: I'm going to merge this now.  Thanks all!
content.html: I'm going to merge this now. Thanks all!

content.raw: Ah, of course.  Thanks, will fix it :).
content.html: Ah, of course. Thanks, will fix it :).

content.raw: If `convertedElem->FirstChildElement("elemBB")` is `nullptr`, line 405 will crash, right?

Code coverage reporting was cranky, so I ended up writing a couple of additional tests to increase our coverage slightly.  Things now seem happier, so if I don't hear any additional comments today, I'll probably merge this.  Thanks for the reviews!
content.html: Code coverage reporting was cranky, so I ended up writing a couple of additional tests to increase our coverage slightly. Things now seem happier, so if I don't hear any additional comments today, I'll probably merge this. Thanks for the reviews!

content.raw: I don't think we need to `ASSERT` here.  That's because we already did an `ASSERT` earlier to ensure that `convertedElem` is not `nullptr`, and here we are just checking that `FirstChildElement("elemBB")` returns what we want.  If this fails, it is in theory possible to go on with the rest of the tests, so I think that `EXPECT` makes sense here.  But feel free to correct me if I missed something.
content.html: I don't think we need to ASSERT here. That's because we already did an ASSERT earlier to ensure that convertedElem is not nullptr, and here we are just checking that FirstChildElement("elemBB") returns what we want. If this fails, it is in theory possible to go on with the rest of the tests, so I think that EXPECT makes sense here. But feel free to correct me if I missed something.

content.raw: Actually, on further reflection, this method can't throw "directly".  That is, it never generates a throw itself, even though it has the `throw` keyword.  Therefore, I'm not sure it makes sense to document it as throwing.  I'm going to leave it as-is for now.
content.html: Actually, on further reflection, this method can't throw "directly". That is, it never generates a throw itself, even though it has the throw keyword. Therefore, I'm not sure it makes sense to document it as throwing. I'm going to leave it as-is for now.

content.raw: Sure, makes sense, I'll add something to parser_urdf.hh.  I'll note that it always could throw before; this is just catching it, doing cleanup, and then re-throwing.
content.html: Sure, makes sense, I'll add something to parser_urdf.hh. I'll note that it always could throw before; this is just catching it, doing cleanup, and then re-throwing.

content.raw: I have some smaller comments which I'll leave up to you
content.html: I have some smaller comments which I'll leave up to you

content.raw: Should we document that the function may throw?
content.html: Should we document that the function may throw?

content.raw: There are a few instances of this, not really introduced by this PR, so no action needed. Just thought I should mention.
content.html: There are a few instances of this, not really introduced by this PR, so no action needed. Just thought I should mention.

content.raw: This check and the one above seem redundant
content.html: This check and the one above seem redundant

content.raw:
Just to add a little bit more color to my initial description:

* The leak in src/Converter.cc happens every time it is used, I think.  I don't think the Converter class is heavily used, but this should clean that leak up.
* The leak in src/parser_urdf.cc only triggers only happens in the error case.
* The changes to Converter_TEST.cc, parser_urdf_TEST.cc, and test/integration/* aren't really necessary, but will make future analysis easier.
content.html:
Just to add a little bit more color to my initial description:

  • The leak in src/Converter.cc happens every time it is used, I think. I don't think the Converter class is heavily used, but this should clean that leak up.
  • The leak in src/parser_urdf.cc only triggers only happens in the error case.
  • The changes to Converter_TEST.cc, parser_urdf_TEST.cc, and test/integration/* aren't really necessary, but will make future analysis easier.
